From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [pɾu.pur.si.uˈna]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [pɾo.por.si.oˈna]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [pɾo.poɾ.si.oˈnaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

proporcionar (first-person singular present proporciono, first-person singular preterite proporcioní, past participle proporcionat); root stress: (Central, Valencia, Balearic) /o/

  1. to provide, supply
    Synonyms: facilitar, subministrar
    Si necessiteu qualsevol informació estaré encantat de proporcionar-vos-la.
    If you need any information I will be happy to provide it.
  2. to proportion
    Synonyms: mesurar, ajustar

Portuguese

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /pɾo.poʁ.si.oˈna(ʁ)/ [pɾo.poh.sɪ.oˈna(h)], (faster pronunciation) /pɾo.poʁ.sjoˈna(ʁ)/ [pɾo.poh.sjoˈna(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /pɾo.poʁ.si.oˈna(ʁ)/ [pɾo.poh.sɪ.oˈna(h)], (faster pronunciation) /pɾo.poʁ.sjoˈna(ʁ)/ [pɾo.poh.sjoˈna(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /pɾo.poɾ.si.oˈna(ɾ)/ [pɾo.poɾ.sɪ.oˈna(ɾ)], (faster pronunciation) /pɾo.poɾ.sjoˈna(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /pɾo.poʁ.si.oˈna(ʁ)/ [pɾo.poχ.sɪ.oˈna(χ)], (faster pronunciation) /pɾo.poʁ.sjoˈna(ʁ)/ [pɾo.poχ.sjoˈna(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /pɾo.poɻ.si.oˈna(ɻ)/ [pɾo.poɻ.sɪ.oˈna(ɻ)], (faster pronunciation) /pɾo.poɻ.sjoˈna(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /pɾu.puɾ.sjuˈnaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /pɾu.puɾ.sjuˈnaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /pɾu.puɾ.sjuˈna.ɾi/

Verb

[edit]

proporcionar (first-person singular present proporciono, first-person singular preterite proporcionei, past participle proporcionado)

  1. to provide, supply
  2. to proportion

2European Portuguese.

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From proporción +‎ -ar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /pɾopoɾθjoˈnaɾ/ [pɾo.poɾ.θjoˈnaɾ] (Spain)
  • IPA(key): /pɾopoɾsjoˈnaɾ/ [pɾo.poɾ.sjoˈnaɾ] (Latin America, Philippines)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: pro‧por‧cio‧nar

Verb

[edit]

proporcionar (first-person singular present proporciono, first-person singular preterite proporcioné, past participle proporcionado)

  1. (transitive) to provide, supply
    Synonyms: proveer, entregar, facilitar, otorgar
    Las viviendas nos proporcionan refugio
    Houses provide us shelter.
    Le proporcioné comida.
    I provided him with food.
    La colina proporciona una buena vista.
    The hill offers a good view.
  2. to adapt, adjust
    Synonyms: adaptar, ajustar
  3. to proportion, set or render in proportion
  4. (reflexive, followed by "de") to get one's hands on
    proporcionarse del título
    get one's hands on the title

[edit]

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.

Related terms

[edit]
